description:
I just got an email from DTCcare about how local help can immediately benefit what‚Äôs happening in Ukraine right now. 

DTCare, a registered 501c3 nonprofit is a humanitarian focused non-profit who is working to supply personal hygiene kits to Ukrainian refugees seeking sanctuary in Poland. 

They currently have 400 kits and 45 boxes of feminine hygiene items ready to send to Poland this week and are open for any help you‚Äôd like to offer. 

Info posted in the graphic and at their profile here: @dt_care 

https://www.dtcare.org/

ITA stands with the people of Ukraine. We've made a $1,000 donation to @careorg who are providing emergency aid to displaced families in the region. If you'd like to support this cause, you may do so by visiting www.care.org.

#ukraine @careorg #donate

üíôüá∫üá¶üíõ You may have noticed that we paused social media over the past week. We are horrified by Russia‚Äôs unprovoked attack of Ukraine & deeply saddened by the resulting loss of life and human suffering. We believe all people have a right to peace and safety. We stand with Ukraine in denouncing this war. 

In response to the mounting humanitarian crisis, we launched a donation campaign with our employees and will be matching all employee donations.

If you have the means to donate, we encourage you to join us in this effort by donating to international humanitarian organization @careorg, which has set up an emergency Ukrainian Crisis Fund. Donations will go toward providing Ukrainians with water, food, supplies, hygiene kits, immediate support and aid, and cash. More information can be found here: https://www.care.org/

#WeStandWithUkraine

We are horrified by Russia‚Äôs unprovoked attack of Ukraine and deeply saddened by the resulting loss of life and human suffering. We believe all people have a right to peace and safety and stand with Ukraine in denouncing this war. In response to the mounting humanitarian crisis, we launched a donation campaign with our employees and will be matching all employee donations.
 
If you have the means to donate, we encourage you to join us in this effort by donating to international humanitarian organization, CARE, which has set up an emergency Ukrainian Crisis Fund. Donations will go toward providing Ukrainians with water, food, supplies, hygiene kits, immediate support and aid, and cash. More information can be found here: https://www.care.org/

10% of all sales in March are being donated to CARE - supporting the Ukraine Emergency www.care.org

Sending love to Ukraineüôèüèæ

‚ÄúLove yourself, love others, love the world‚Äù this is our mantra at @getlovedup 

In our current times it has never been more important to show some love to our suffering world, more precisely the country that‚Äôs under attack, the Ukraine. It is easy to get caught up in the fear and darkness humankind is experiencing and feel heartbroken and helpless, however it is important for us to not let that outshine the love that is happening and how we can support the people of Ukraine in this moment.‚ú®

To shift the energy towards hope and healing vs fear, I want to outline some amazing initiatives that show the love that is still in humanity:

1. People all over the world have been booking Airbnb homes and shopping from Etsy artisans to help Ukrainian locals.

2. The people of Russia have been protesting against the war with the risk of going to prison.

3. People from neighboring countries have opened their boarders to receive those fleeing from the fight 

The Care initiative: I‚Äôm so grateful to have a platform to reach many people, as it‚Äôs in these difficult moments that my purpose becomes even more present, to raise the vibration of the world and support collective love consciousness. I have linked the Care initiative in my bio to support their immediate crisis and reach millions of Ukrainians with emergency aid. To donate to this fundraiser just clink link or spread the word. Discover more here: https://www.care.org

An affirmation to pray for Ukraine:

I pray for every person on this earth‚Äôs right for justice, equity, and equality. 

If you know of any ways to continue supporting the Ukrainian community, please feel free to share them below so we can spread the love in the world.‚ú®

The impact of current events in Ukraine has been devastating and our hearts go out to the people of Ukraine. We‚Äôll be donating $20,000 to non-profit organization CARE‚Äôs Ukraine Crisis Fund, an immediate crisis response to rush water, food, hygiene kits, and ongoing support for Ukrainian families. @CareOrg works around the globe to save lives, defeat poverty and achieve social justice, with a focus on women and children. You can learn more at www.care.org, and our Stories, where we're posting more resources.‚Å†
‚Å†
We'll also be matching our employees' donations to support Ukrainian relief. Thank you to our community for your constant support, which allows us to give back to causes close to our heart through our Glow for Good social impact program.

"Care There" Ukraine Donation Opportunity- All Week 

A humanitarian catastrophe is unfolding in Ukraine as attacks of war put millions of lives at risk. Innocent families, women and girls, and the elderly will suffer as much as those on the front lines of fighting. CARE‚Äôs Ukraine Crisis Fund aims to reach those groups with immediate aid and recovery, food, water, hygiene kits, psychosocial support and cash assistance. 

During the Week of Caring, the Town of West Springfield and Agawam encourage residents to support these vulnerable populations through donations to the Ukraine Crisis Fund. Donations can be made online anytime during the Week of Caring by going to CARE'S website (linked below). Residents may also stop by the West Springfield Senior Center on Saturday, March 26 between 9am-1pm to donate. Cash and checks will be taken during that time. 

https://my.care.org/site/Donation2?31071.donation=form1&df_id=31071&mfc_pref=T

We‚Äôre committed to supporting Ukraine by donating $100,000 to CARE through matching funds and contributions from the Aquent Australia community.

Please donate today via our fundraising page to help provide urgent relief to the 4 million people impacted by the crisis: care.org/aquent

Lyudmila is a volunteer in #Ukraine who provides meals and medicine to people in need. 

In Ukraine, CARE supports a number of partner organizations that have a proven track record in development cooperation and humanitarian aid. 

Volunteers and smaller local initiatives receive financial support to help efforts on the ground. 

Visit care.org/Ukraine to support volunteers like Lyudmila üß°
